page.title: 08Education in Strensall
page.content: There are two{playschools}and one {nursery school}for children of three to five years.Each has an average attendance of 24 children who attend three or four mornings per week for 3 hours and enjoy learning through play. From the age of five the children attend the{Robert Wilkinson Primary {School.}The present school was built {in }1972 with a separate block of four classrooms added in 1980.In 1985 there are 303 children and 12 full time staff.At the school the numbers have doubled since this new school was built.40% of the children live on the {Army Camp}situated one mile outside the village.The school has large grounds incorporating a playing field copse and a pond.At the age of 11 the children transfer to{comprehensive {schools.}About 180 children travel by bus to the{Joseph Rowntree School.
